timeline.bodyText:
there should be 1 statement per line
save the storage manager into a final so we don't need to call the getter over and over again; bonus: value returned by the getter can become null between invocations, defying safety null check.
same for account
timeline.author: ezaquarii

timeline.bodyText: Ok, so what happens if the upgrade fails? It looks like we completely ignore that fac and just happily continue like all is fine. This is pretty much undefined behavior.
timeline.author: ezaquarii

replies.bodyText: That seemed to be enough for the 56 upgrades before :)
replies.author: kesselb

replies.bodyText:
I'm not a fan of idea that it's ok make bad things worse.
If the upgrade fails, we should be notified about it properly, not via some urelated crash. If we can't or don't want to do anything, I'd throw exception. This will trigger an error message pop-up that - with a bit of luck - will land in our issues page with a spot-on error message.
Hopefully, if we set a good example, this behaviour will stop here.
replies.author: ezaquarii
ezaquarii

replies.bodyText:
Let us move this away from this PR.
Both of you are right: it is a nasty way, but we are doing it since the beginning of the app.
Let us discus it in a new issue and then we can change it afterwards.
